Posts.Content: May 21, 2010 04:59AM blane5 wrote: Count me in re: feeling angry Lindy!  For sure.  And I didn't used to be an angry person either.  I once read that when we feel sadness and hurt, it can be pushed inward, which can result in depression or it can be directed outward and manifest as anger.  After my four surgeries, with the last one a mastectomy, I have often felt very angry.  At the heart of my anger is sadness and grief.  You also write that you feel like your world is "out of control."  Having breast cancer has made me feel terribly powerless at times, leading to frustration, and anger; anger... sadness... anger...  sadness (and repeat).  I realize that the life I had planned for myself is not entirely within my control and during the last few months, my plans have been derailed by breast cancer. ((((gentle hugs))))
Posts.Title: Feeling Angry after Surgery Lindy323 neversurrender

Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2010 02:34PM - edited Jun 7, 2010 02:35PM by blane5 I tried pieces of soft flannelette material and I also used unscented mini pads/sanitary napkins stuck back-to-back.  I also liked to wear a loose t-shirt and often put a small pillow between my arm and my side.  I wiped my underarms with unscented baby wipes.  I tried cornstarch in my arm pit instead of deodarant.  I found my lymph node surgeries/incisions were very uncomfortable!
